conclusion: Determine how objects A, B, C, and D will change when the light source moves to the right, above the objects.
Object A is a small brown object.
The light source is moving to the right, above the objects.
The light source will move to the right, which means it will be above the objects.
The objects will move downward and to the left.
The size of the objects will not change because they are stationary objects.
The size of the light source will change because it is moving.
Object A will move downward and to the left.
Object B will move downward and to the left.
Object C will move downward and to the left.
Object D will move downward and to the left.
The size of the light source will change because it is moving.
When the light source moves to the right, above the objects, the objects will move downward and to the left, and the size of the light source will change.
